summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2019 discussing an investigation into harassing emails sent to Mark Epstein. It involves FBI agents and private security analysts from T&M Protection Resources analyzing email headers and discussing a missing YouTube video link sent by 'Jeff' that allegedly contained a mock interview with Steve Bannon.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.role: Recipient of harassing emails, brother of Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He is the subject of the email investigation, having received harassing emails and a YouTube video link from 'Jeff'. He is attempting to locate the original email and video.

persons.name: Richard Frankel
persons.context: He forwarded the initial report about harassing emails to the FBI and is involved in the security investigation concerning Mark Epstein.

persons.name: William Barry
persons.role: Cyber Security Analyst at T&M Protection Resources
persons.context: He analyzed the email headers from the harassing emails sent to Mark Epstein and provided a zip file with the analysis and email copies.

persons.name: Simon Ragona
persons.role: Managing Director of Cybersecurity at T&M Protection Resources
persons.context: He communicated with Mark Epstein to obtain the original emails, provided an update on the header analysis, and described the missing YouTube video involving Jeff and Steve Bannon.

persons.name: Jeff
persons.role: Sender of an email to Mark Epstein
persons.context: He allegedly sent Mark Epstein an email containing a YouTube link to a 'mock interview' between himself and Steve Bannon, which was later taken down.

persons.name: Steve Bannon
persons.context: He was reportedly featured in a YouTube 'mock interview' with Jeff, which was sent to Mark Epstein and later became unavailable.

persons.name: William Weller
persons.role: Recipient of internal emails at T&M Protection Resources
persons.context: He is copied on internal emails discussing the investigation into the harassing emails sent to Mark Epstein.

persons.name: Steven Petronio
persons.role: Recipient of internal emails at T&M Protection Resources
persons.context: He is copied on internal emails discussing the investigation into the harassing emails sent to Mark Epstein.

connections.description: Richard Frankel, an attorney at T&M Protection Resources, is handling a security matter involving harassing emails sent to Mark Epstein.
Simon Ragona communicated with Mark Epstein to obtain original emails for a cybersecurity investigation.
Jeff sent Mark Epstein an email containing a YouTube video link, indicating some form of prior communication or acquaintance.
Jeff and Steve Bannon were reportedly featured together in a 'mock interview' on a YouTube video.
Both are employees of T&M Protection Resources working on the same cybersecurity investigation for Mark Epstein.

events.title: Harassing emails reported
events.description: Richard Frankel forwards emails about harassment targeting Mark Epstein to the FBI.

events.title: Email header analysis completed
events.description: William Barry completes analysis of email headers from harassing emails sent to Mark Epstein, finding they routed through UK Yahoo servers.

events.title: YouTube video sent to Mark Epstein
events.description: Jeff sends Mark Epstein an email with a YouTube link to a 'mock interview' between Jeff and Steve Bannon, containing comments about Trump. The video was later taken down.

keyFacts: Mark Epstein, Jeffrey Epstein's brother, was the target of harassing emails in 2019, prompting an investigation by private security firm T&M Protection Resources and the FBI.
A key piece of evidence sought was a YouTube video link sent to Mark Epstein by 'Jeff', featuring a 'mock interview' with Steve Bannon that included comments about Trump and their relationship.

The harassing emails were traced through UK Yahoo email servers, but the YouTube video had been taken down and the original email/link from Jeff could not be located by Mark Epstein at the time of the investigation.
The email chain demonstrates post-Jeffrey Epstein's death (July 2019) investigative activity and concerns regarding his brother Mark and potential digital evidence.
